intro: Speculantha recta, commonly known as the straight-leaved speculantha, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces showy, violet-colored blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
